title: AU Deals: Steamy Spring Sale Must Owns, Console Store Gift Cards Reduced, Dirt Cheap AAAs, and More!
description: Whether you're after demon-slaying RPGs, chaotic kitchen co-op, or open-world adventures, this week's gaming bargains have you covered.
author: Adam Mathew
byline: The Best Gaming Deals In Australia

text: Whoâ€™s ready to sprint-slide into some ripper deals? Whether you're after demon-slaying RPGs, chaotic kitchen co-op, or open-world adventures, this week's gaming bargains have you covered. Of particular focus is the ongoing Steam Spring Sale. Itâ€™s currently destroying my wallet. Allow me to help it eviscerate yours too.This Day in Gaming ðŸŽ‚In retro news, I'm celebrating the 25th anniversary of Fear Effect, a four-discer I adored at launch and would kill to see revived again. The formula was basically an early Resi Evil/fixed camera affair that had more engaging stealth/gunplay, actually decent voice acting, a badass cyberpunk setting, and adult imagery galore. The latter made it reminiscent of early '90s anime for meâ€”sweary, hard-boiled characters, goretastic death cinematics, and some fan service (implied) nudity. Sadly, it doesn't hold up well today, visually, thanks to its unique fusion of 3D models with low-bitrate video backdrops.Cover art. I wish it looked this good in the flesh. html:
Whoâ€™s ready to sprint-slide into some ripper deals? Whether you're after demon-slaying RPGs, chaotic kitchen co-op, or open-world adventures, this week's gaming bargains have you covered. Of particular focus is the ongoing Steam Spring Sale. Itâ€™s currently destroying my wallet. Allow me to help it eviscerate yours too.

This Day in Gaming ðŸŽ‚

In retro news, I'm celebrating the 25th anniversary of Fear Effect, a four-discer I adored at launch and would kill to see revived again. The formula was basically an early Resi Evil/fixed camera affair that had more engaging stealth/gunplay, actually decent voice acting, a badass cyberpunk setting, and adult imagery galore. The latter made it reminiscent of early '90s anime for meâ€”sweary, hard-boiled characters, goretastic death cinematics, and some fan service (implied) nudity. Sadly, it doesn't hold up well today, visually, thanks to its unique fusion of 3D models with low-bitrate video backdrops.

- ÅŒkamiden (DS) 2011. eBay

Nice Savings for Nintendo Switch

Over on the Switch, the PokÃ©mon-inspired Shin Megami Tensei V (A$42, down 48%) lets you fuse demons into powerful allies. Meanwhile, Overcooked! 2 (A$10, down 75%) tests friendships like no other in some of the most delicious semi-co-op you can consume.

Shin Megami Tensei V

If you're looking for a meaty, demanding, endlessly deep, and overall outstanding JRPG to sink your teeth into, Shin Megami Tensei V has heaping portions of it. 8/10, great.

Then thereâ€™s The Witcher 3: Complete Edition (A$16, down 80%). You havenâ€™t lived a full gamer life until youâ€™ve clocked it.

Pure Scores for PlayStation

PS5 players arenâ€™t left out either. Elden Ring (A$74, down 26%) is brutal but rewarding with its understated George R.R. Martin -crafted lore. Bottom line: Elden Ring's open-world exploration is a new benchmark. It's constantly exciting, rewarding, and full of moments that made me go "woahhh" (or swear after I died while gawking).
